articles.title: Chris Matthews calls Trump’s speech an ‘extraordinarily...
articles.description: On President Trump blaming the Obama Adminsitration for the current tensions with Iran, Chris Matthews says "That's an extraordinarily partisan attack amidst an international crisis right now."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Stavridis: Trump speech didn't detail plan to move forward, just 'continuing threats against Iran'
articles.description: Adm. James Stavridis shares his reaction to President Trump's speech from the White House Wednesday after Iran fired more than a dozen ballistic missiles at two Iraqi air bases housing U.S. forces in retaliation to the killing of Iranian Gen. Qassem Soleimani.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Wednesday's Campaign Round-Up, 1.8.20
articles.description: Today's installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.
articles.content:
Today’s installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.
* More than five weeks after his guilty plea, Rep. Duncan Hunter (R-Calif.) submitted his resignation letter yesterday. As the Associated Press noted, California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D… [+1677 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. Bennet: Other nations don't trust us now
articles.description: Senator Michael Bennet (D-CO) joins Hallie Jackson to discuss the fallout following the assassination of Iranian General Qasem Soleimani. Bennet laments the consequences of this action, including the distrust it has fostered among our allies and adversaries a…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. Manchin: Now is the time for 'super-diplomacy'
articles.description: Senator Joe Manchin (D-WV) is with Hallie Jackson as the White House debates its next steps in the conflict with Iran. Manchin suggests diplomacy and a setting of "parameters" are the only ways to diffuse the tension.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Trump tries to argue that Bolton's testimony wouldn't matter
articles.description: Trump argued yesterday that Bolton "would know nothing" relevant to the impeachment scandal. There's a whole lot of evidence suggesting otherwise.
articles.content: Former White House National Security Adviser John Bolton jolted the debate over Donald Trump’s impeachment trial this week, announcing that he’s willing to testify. As we discussed yesterday, it created a challenge Senate Republicans would have preferred to a… [+1946 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rhodes: There were no casualties, but that doesn't mean this is over
articles.description: President Obama's Deputy National Security Adviser, Ben Rhodes, joins MSNBC's Stephanie Ruhle to discuss Iran's missile attack on U.S. forces in Iraq, and details the potential fallout and repercussions that may follow.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: 'The worst national security team that I've ever seen'
articles.description: Andrea Mitchell said Trump has "the worst national security team that I've ever seen." There's ample evidence to bolster the point.
articles.content: Andrea Mitchell, NBC News chief foreign affairs correspondent, sat down with Brian Williams last night and reflected on the White House team responding to the crisis in the Middle East. She characterized Donald Trump’s existing operation as least experienced,… [+2236 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Fmr. Marine and congressman says Soleimani killing could be a win
articles.description: Fmr. Marine Corps. officer, Rep. Mike Gallagher, R-Wis., joins Morning Joe to discuss the U.S. airstrike on Gen. Soleimani, Iran's retaliation and why the killing could be a national security win.
